sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Tragedy in Nepal as at least 67 people are killed in a plane crash near the city of Pokhara.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Russia has unleashed a new wave of major attacks on Ukraine hitting infrastructure across the country and killing at least a dozen of people in the city of Dnipro.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: US President Joe Biden's lawyers found five more pages of classified documents at his personal residence

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: on the same day a special counsel was appointed to investigate the matter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: At least 67 people have died after a 72-seat passenger aircraft crashed in Nepal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Videos showed plumes of smoke billowing from the crash site as rescue workers and crowds of people gathered around the wreckage of the aircraft.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Nepalese soldiers were also involved in the rescue efforts at the crash site.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The plane was flying from the capital Kathmandu to Pokhara, the gateway to the Annapurna circuit, a popular hiking trail in the Himalayas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It was not immediately clear what caused the plane to crash.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In total it was carrying 68 passengers and four crew members, according to the Kathmandu Post.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Nepal is home to eight of the world's 14 highest mountains, including Mount Everest, and has a history of air crashes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Russia launched a new wave of major attacks on Ukraine, hitting energy infrastructure across the country and killing at least a dozen people in a missile strike on this nine-story building in the city of Dnipro. The Ukrainian president called for more help from the international community.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Is it possible to stop the Russian terror?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Yes, it is, said Volodymyr Zelensky, the president of Ukraine, calling the international community to send more weapons to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In the northeastern Kharkiv region, the governor said two Russian missiles hit critical infrastructure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: No casualties have been reported, but emergency power cuts in the city and around were possible, the official said.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Much of Ukraine is now under an emergency blackout after missiles hit power infrastructure in several cities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Lawyers for U.S. President Joe Biden found more classified documents than previously known at his home in Delaware on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: A special counsel is investigating the president's handling of the files, which relates to his time as Barack Obama's vice president.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He's restored independence in the Department of Justice. That's what we're doing here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: When we're saying we're going to refer you to the Department of Justice, that is restoring independence as it relates to issues like this. And that is important to the president.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And it's been consistent. What I am saying about investigations has been consistent for the last two years. You've heard me over and over again when it comes to a legal issue or a matter like this. We have always referred to the Department of Justice. So there's nothing here different here. These documents are in addition to the discovery of others found in December in Biden's garage and in November at his former office. It comes during an ongoing investigation into former President Donald Trump's own alleged mishandling of classified files.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Peru has declared a state of emergency in the capital Lima

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: as well as several other regions following demonstrations against President Dina Boulirate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The measure will be in force for 30 days, giving the army more powers to maintain order as well as suspending certain liberties such as freedom of movement and assembly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: At least 42 people have died in the country over the past five weeks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Demonstrators are demanding Boulirate's resignation and that fresh elections be held.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Tens of thousands of Portuguese teachers and school staff marched onto the streets of the capital Lisbon to demand higher wages and better working conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Protesters held banners and shouted slogans as they demanded the education minister step down, claiming the government has done little to improve their situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The demonstrators say their current wages are too low, especially given the cost of living crisis.
